com.palamida.common.io

Class Systems

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.palamida.common.io.Systems

  • public final class Systems
extends Object
    Static utility methods useful for working with system-dependent tasks.
    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static File edit(File file)
      Launches the system associated editor application and opens the specified file for editing.
      static File open(File file)
      Opens the specified file with the system associated application.

      Reassigns the "standard" error stream to the given file, using the specified charset.

      Starts a new system-dependent process.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public static Process start(List<String> command)
                     throws IOException
        Starts a new system-dependent process.
        Parameters:
        command - the list containing the program and its arguments
        Returns:
        the Process object representing the started process
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs while starting the process

      • startAndWait

        public static Process startAndWait(List<String> command)
                            throws InterruptedException,
                                   IOException
        Starts a new system-dependent process and waits for it to finish before returning.
        Parameters:
        command - the list containing the program and its arguments
        Returns:
        the Process object representing the started process
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted by another thread while it is waiting, then the wait is ended and an InterruptedException is thrown
        IOException - if an error occurs while starting the process

      • edit

        public static File edit(File file)
                 throws IOException
        Launches the system associated editor application and opens the specified file for editing.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to edit
        Returns:
        the specified file
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • open

        public static File open(File file)
                 throws IOException
        Opens the specified file with the system associated application.
        Parameters:
        file - the file or directory to open
        Returns:
        the specified file
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • setOut

        public static void setOut(File path,
          Charset charset,
          boolean autoFlush)
                   throws IOException
        Reassigns the "standard" output stream to the given file, using the specified charset.
        Parameters:
        path - the specified file
        charset - the character set to use when writing the lines
        autoFlush - if true, the output buffer will be flushed whenever a byte array is written, one of the println methods is invoked, or a newline character or byte ('\n') is written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • setErr

        public static void setErr(File path,
          Charset charset,
          boolean autoFlush)
                   throws IOException
        Reassigns the "standard" error stream to the given file, using the specified charset.
        Parameters:
        path - the specified file
        charset - the character set to use when writing the lines
        autoFlush - if true, the output buffer will be flushed whenever a byte array is written, one of the println methods is invoked, or a newline character or byte ('\n') is written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
